sentences.english: Resistant to blight, tolerate to re-plant and drought. Wide adaption.
sentences.chinese: 抗枯萎病能力强，耐重茬，耐旱，适应广。

sentences.english: Soon the leaves will be discarded, the grass will sere.
sentences.chinese: 很快树叶将凋落，小草将枯萎。

sentences.english: This time I, it was the winter the withering grass, in a world of ice and snow in blur.
sentences.chinese: 此时的我，正是冬日枯萎的小草，在冰天雪地里迷离。

sentences.english: The flower languished from lack of water.
Flowers soon faded when they have been cut.
sentences.chinese: 花剪下后很快就会枯萎。

sentences.english: You have to feed the fire of your network or it will wither or die.
sentences.chinese: 你要不断的为你的人系网络加料，以保证其不会枯萎。

sentences.english: Autumn wind blows, I gradually withered.
sentences.chinese: 秋风吹来，我渐渐枯萎了。

sentences.english: The dry spell blighted the crops.
sentences.chinese: 干旱期使农作物枯萎了。

sentences.english: The flowers withered away for lack of sunshine .
sentences.chinese: 花朵因缺少阳光而枯萎了。

sentences.english: The womb shrivelled within a few months.
sentences.chinese: 那个子宫几个月以后枯萎了。

sentences.english: If we follow the path of returning to sanity, they will wither.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们遵循回归理智的道路，基地组织就会枯萎。

sentences.english: Like a flower he blossoms and then withers; like a shadow he flees and never stays.
sentences.chinese: 他象朵花似的盛开而后枯萎，象影子似的漂浮不定。

sentences.english: The right time to collect rhizome should be at the stage of twining stem withering.
sentences.chinese: 合适的采挖期仍以地上缠绕茎枯萎期为宜。

sentences.english: The red and the white rose were whithering in the cold.
sentences.chinese: 红玫瑰和白玫瑰由于天冷正在枯萎。

definition: to wither (and drop off)/to wilt/to pass away
